verbose_text: GluN2B antagonists trigger their antidepressant effects by altering the activity of mTOR [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR], suggesting that inhibiting the activity of GluN2B subunit containing NMDA receptors accounts for the majority of the antidepressant effects of ketamine.
evidence: GluN2B antagonists trigger their antidepressant effects by altering the activity of mTOR
